metadata.title: CVE-2024-21890 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: The Node.js Permission Model does not clarify in the documentation thatwildcards should be only used as the last character of a file path. Forexample:``` --allow-fs-read=/home/node/.ssh/*.pub```will ignore `pub` and give access to everything after `.ssh/`.This misleading documentation affects all users using the experimentalpermission model in Node.js 20 and Node.js 21.Please note that at the time this CVE was issued, the permission model isan experimental feature of Node.js.

criterions.comment: nodejs: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
